README.md:
# OpenClaw

OpenClaw is a high-performance WebSocket gateway for real-time applications.

## Architecture

- Core gateway written in Rust for performance
- Plugin system for extensibility
- WebSocket protocol compliance (RFC 6455)
- Horizontal scaling via Redis pub/sub

## Goals

- Sub-millisecond message routing
- 100K+ concurrent connections per node
- Zero-downtime deployments
- Full RFC 6455 compliance

## Non-Goals

- HTTP REST API (use a separate service)
- Database ORM (out of scope)
- UI framework (frontend is separate)

## Contributing

See CONTRIBUTING.md for guidelines.
CONTRIBUTING.md:
# Contributing to OpenClaw

## Code Style

- Follow Rust conventions (cargo fmt, cargo clippy)
- All public APIs must have doc comments
- No unsafe code without justification in comments

## PR Guidelines

- One feature/fix per PR
- Include tests for all new functionality
- Update CHANGELOG.md
- Keep PRs under 500 lines when possible

## Architecture Decisions

- All protocol handling goes in `src/protocol/`
- Plugins must implement the `Plugin` trait
- No direct database access from gateway code
- Metrics via Prometheus exporter only

## What We Accept

- Bug fixes with tests
- Performance improvements with benchmarks
- Protocol compliance fixes
- Plugin API extensions

## What We Don't Accept

- REST API endpoints in the gateway
- UI components
- ORM or database layers
- Breaking changes to the plugin API without RFC
